definition: to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book
lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic

sentences.english: Bee sting on the fly out of people.
The scorpion says, ‘Because if I do, I will die too’.
sentences.chinese: 蝎子就说，‘我要是蜇你的话，我自己也会死的。’

sentences.english: The frog asks, ‘How do I know you won’t sting me?’
sentences.chinese: 青蛙问，‘我怎么知道你会不会蜇我？’

sentences.english: For example, honeybees are great builders. Beehive construction begins with finding a suitable site.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，蜜蜂是伟大的建筑师，而绝非仅仅是蜇人。

sentences.english: An average person believes that bees can sting one to death.
sentences.chinese: 一般人认为，蜜蜂可以蜇人死亡。

sentences.english: Cut eggplant, born on the affected part, can treat the centipede bites and stung.
sentences.chinese: 生茄子切开，搽患部，可治蜈蚣咬伤和蜂蜇。

sentences.english: They looked loke a gigantic scorpions with stings curled over their backs.
sentences.chinese: 它们看上去好似一条蜇针卷在背上的巨蝎。

sentences.english: They buzzed around the prince and stung his face and hands.
sentences.chinese: 它们嗡嗡嗡地围在王子四周，蜇他的脸和手。

sentences.english: Honey is sweet, but the bee stings .
sentences.chinese: 蜜是甜的，但蜜峰却会蜇人。

sentences.english: Ndiaye also put into a tube to wasp to sting god was kneeling down to beg for mercy.
sentences.chinese: 阿耶又放了一筒地马蜂进去，把门神蜇得跪地求饶。

sentences.english: A wasp stung me on the arm.
There are several painful spots in my mouth, and salty and sour things make it sting.
sentences.chinese: 我嘴里有几块地方疼，咸的和酸的都蜇着疼。

sentences.english: There have been reports of people hospitalised in France after suffering anaphylactic shock as a result of multiple stings.
sentences.chinese: 在法国已经有关于人类被蜇而导致过敏的报道。

sentences.english: Then a single gnat got into his ear and stung him.
sentences.chinese: 然后，一只小蚊蚋跳进他的耳朵，蜇了他。

sentences.english: Yes, I have been stung by a bee.

definition: variant of 馬蜂|马蜂[ma3 feng1]
Deinagkistrodon, a venomous pit viper/also called five-paced viper (i.e. can grow to five paces)
variant of 癢|痒[yang3]/to itch/to tickle
